author: louissealey1
title: Liverpool target Timo Werner admits it would be ‘special’ to play at Anfield
text:
Timo Werner started for Germany against England on Wednesday evening (Picture: Getty) Liverpool target Timo Werner admits it would be ‘special’ to play at Anfield in the future.
However, the German forward says he feels ‘at home’ at Leipzig, suggesting his immediate future lies in the Bundesliga.
Antonio Conte report card: Near-perfect start with Chelsea on course for the double Werner has emerged as a target for the Reds this season after scoring 14 goals in 22 appearances in the German top-flight.
It is believed Anfield chiefs have been in contact with Leipzig, attempting to see whether a deal for the 21-year-old could materialise in the summer.
Werner insists it would be a special feeling to play at Anfield, but the attacker intends to evolve as a player at his current club.
‘If you were to play at Anfield and hear the fans sing ‘You’ll Never Walk Alone,’ it would certainly be something special,’ he told Sport Bild .
Timo Werner has been linked with a move to Liverpool this summer (Picture: Getty) ‘England has a different feel, but I am also still young player.
‘I feel at home here at RB right now. Leipzig can continue to grow, and if I could be part it I’d be delighted.’
